body:
Comment 2 by **aburkett@sieinc.com**: 
You're probably right in that it should be a separate package.  I just used the base64
functionality since I could swap out the encoding string, and use the decode function,
which aside from the padding with = is the same exact function.  And since I don't have
much experience with bitwise operations, I figured I'd just reuse the function.

For now, my quick hack of doing a Replace of ='s with another character before decoding
is fine. At some point I may make a proper uuencode package.  I'm not sure uuencoding is
important enough to require it to be handled by the standard library.
